title: Communication and Events Coordinator At Nat' Crime Victim Law Institute Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview consisted of four separate in-person interviews of about 20-30 minutes in length with either one individual or a pair. It ended up being about 2 1/2 hours. After getting through the first round, I was invited back for four more separate interviews of about the same length. It felt like the process dragged on because the interview slots available were over a two week period. Then a couple of weeks went by and the second round of interview slots were also over a two week period. I didn't hear anything back after the second round, and after a month, I received a snail mail rejection letter.
Interview Questions: What would be the first project you would tackle in your first three months?

title: Assistant Director of Gift Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very communicative and highly professional. Kept you in the loop about where you were in the interview process. Asked questions that were directly related to the position and were very honest about job responsibilities to make sure the candidate would be the right fit.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know about communications/sales experience and how it would be applicable to establishing long-term relationships with donors

title: IT Service Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back one on one interview. I was asked a few questions about my availability, skills, and experience with customer suppport. I provided a resume but they mostly just assessed my personality for this entry level position.
Interview Questions: If someone's computer is starting slowly, what would you recommend?

title: Peer Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was awesome! I was Initially applying for a student assistant position, but the employer felt I would be a better fit for a different position in the career center, a peer career advisor. The employer directed me to another recruiter and received a interview on the same day.
Interview Questions:
What interest you about this position?
What skills do you bring to this position?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with some financial aid staff + 1 person from Admissions. Next, in-person interview with financial aid staff. First round is with Director, Associate Director, and Assistant Director. Next round is with the rest of the staff in a more casual setting.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions and questions relating to financial aid. What is your biggest strength/weakness? Why do you want to work in financial aid? Tell us about your experience talking with not only students, but older folks (parents). Basically, can you communicate with all different kinds of people?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College
Interview Descriptions: Apply online then call for interview.  No need to network. My boss wasnt even there in the interview day but 5 others board will take turn asking you questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would work for us

title: Student Life Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a preliminary interview with the Acting Student Life Intern (the individual doing the job that I was interviewing for). After I passed the preliminary interview, I moved on to an interview with the Supervising Faculty Member (the individual who would be supervising me in my role if I were to be selected.)
Interview Questions: How will you balance the demands of this job with your academic studies?

title: Assistant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two people of 7 person board interviewed me for an extension of a temporary position I already had. They had previously offered me the position, but then opened it up to other employees. I was interviewed in person and asked some questions about the program by the two leads of the program. There were no pre-organized questions.
Interview Questions: How long I expected to be there.

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: This interview process was not candidate-friendly. The information about who would do the interviewing, the logistics for travels, and the job description were either unclear or underemphasized in initial contacts.
Interview Questions: There were no technical questions and, in fact, few questions. It seemed as though the faculty were unprepared to bring candidates to campus.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received an initial phone interview by hiring manager.  I then met with three different committees that represented the academic and administrative side of the position. Each meeting had a combination of professors, administrators, deans and students.  I met with students alone as well.  I was given a tour of the campus and met with HR and given the opportunity to ask questions about the work environment.
Interview Questions: I was asked questions in the languages that listed on my resume by native speakers.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lewis & Clark College (Portland, OR) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is similar to that at other academic institutions. After submitting an application packet I had one phone interview and then was invited to campus of a teaching demonstration and research talk.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question related to expertise and experience in a liberal arts environment.
